_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Bonjour Tremblant!

What a morning on the mountain! We woke up to 14 cm of fresh snow overnight, and those big, beautiful snowflakes are still falling, turning the entire mountain into a winter wonderland. Thanks to the incredible dedication of our teams who worked through the night, we’re proud to offer 102 open runs today—a huge accomplishment! Conditions are absolutely stunning, spirits are high, and everything is lining up for an epic day on the slopes. We couldn’t be happier to share it with you!

With 4 Terrain Parks open, there’s plenty to explore for riders of all levels, whether you’re just starting out or highly experienced. Come ride with us!

First Tracks:  Early access to designated lifts on both the North and South sides, starting at 7:45 a.m.

Looking to explore beyond the lifts? We have 15 designated areas open for those who prefer Snowshoeing or Alpine Touring. Enjoy the fresh snowfall while discovering quieter corners of the mountain and taking in the winter scenery.

Fresh snow is waiting—see you out soon! 

Mountain safety tip of the week: Be careful when using the ski lifts.
Knowing how to board ski lifts is essential to ensure the safety of all users.
 
Snow fall is recorded daily at 5 a.m from mid-mountain at North Side (550 m / 1,800 ft). This data, based on 24 hours, provides a picture of on-mountain conditions. Actual accumulation may differ from the official report. Be aware of changing conditions. Lifts and trails exist in a mountain environment and may close due to weather, usage and/or special maintenance.
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReport: This Wednesday, we received 14 cm of fresh snow. Thanks to the hard work of our teams, the mountain is in excellent condition with 102 trails open, 65 groomed runs, 4 snow parks, & 15 sections for Alpine Touring and Snowshoeing. Fresh snow is waiting—see you out soon! Please remember to ski and ride safely at all times.
_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReportFrench: Ce mercredi, nous avons reçu 14  cm de neige fraîche. Grâce au travail ardu de nos équipes, la montagne est en excellente condition avec 102 pistes ouvertes, 65 pistes damées, 4 parks à neige et 15 sections pour le ski de randonnée et la raquette. La neige fraîche vous attend, à bientôt ! N'oubliez pas de skier et de glisser en toute sécurité en tout temps.
